한 세션 안에서 윈도우를 만들고 전환하며 현재 작업 위치를 잃지 않는 기: Learn the basic routine of creating and switching windows within a single session and never losing your current working position.

한 윈도우를 분할한 터미널 영역입니다. 코드/로그/테스트를 병렬로 볼 때: This is a terminal area that divides one window. Used to view code/logs/tests in parallel.
한 화면에서 코드/테스트/로그를 동시에 다루는 멀티패인 작업의 기본을 익: Learn the basics of multipane operations that simultaneously handle code/tests/logs on one screen. Create a sense of layout by repeatedly selecting the division direction and adjusting the size.

tmux 명령 실행 기록이 없어 첫 진입 성공 신호가 부족함: There is no record of tmux command execution, so there is a lack of first entry success signal.
tmux 명령을 직접 실행하는 모드입니다. 복합 동작 자동화에 유용합니다: A mode for executing tmux commands directly. Useful for automating complex actions.
tmux 액션 로그에 {{value}} 기록이 있어야 함: There must be a record {{value}} in the tmux action log.

tmux는 터미널 작업을 세션으로 보존하고, 창과 패인을 통해 병렬 작업: tmux is a tool that preserves terminal tasks as sessions and allows stable operation of parallel tasks through windows and panes. This curriculum is designed so that even developers who are new to tmux can understand it through hands-on practice.
tmux는 하나의 터미널에서 여러 작업을 유지/전환하고, 연결이 끊겨도: tmux is a terminal multiplexer that allows you to maintain/switch multiple tasks on a single terminal and recover sessions if the connection is lost. First, read the official introduction, check the installation guide appropriate for your OS, and then start practicing.
tmux를 \"작업 복구와 연속성\" 도구로 이해하고, 이후 레슨에서 계: Understand tmux as a "task recovery and continuity" tool, and learn the basic verification routines (`tmux -V`, `tmux list-sessions`) that you will continue to use in later lessons.
tmux를 실전 운영 루틴으로 익히는 가장 빠른 학습 플로우: The fastest learning flow to learn tmux with practical operation routines
tmux를 쓰는 가장 큰 이유인 \"작업 복구\"를 다룹니다. 네트워크: It covers “task recovery,” which is the biggest reason for using tmux. Create operating habits that do not lose sessions even in network disconnection or terminal shutdown situations.

It covers “task recovery,” which is the biggest reason for using tmux. Create operating habits that do not lose sessions even in network disconnection or terminal shutdown situations. This lesson is about repeating the same task using shortcut keys to familiarize yourself with it.
tmux를 처음 켜보는 온램프 레슨입니다. SSH가 끊기거나 터미널을 닫: This is an onramp lesson for using tmux for the first time. Within 3 minutes, you can feel the core value of being able to continue working even if SSH is disconnected or the terminal is closed.
v86 초기화 실패 (bios/wasm 경로 확인 필요): v86 initialization failed (need to check bios/wasm path)
window 2개 이상 상태에서 세션 운영: Session operation with two or more windows
window 생성 미완료로 command mode 실전 적용이 검증되지: The actual application of command mode has not been verified due to the window creation not being completed.
window를 2개 이상 만든 뒤 `tmux next-window` 또는: After creating two or more windows, run `tmux next-window` or `tmux previous-window`.
workspace 점검 루틴이 없어 다음 작업 전환 시 위치를 잃기 쉬움: There is no workspace inspection routine, so it is easy to lose your position when switching to the next task.

We refined VM boot paths and status indicators for more stable re-entry into practice.
레슨 가이드, 미션 순서, 힌트 흐름을 통합해 처음부터 따라가기 쉽게 정: Lesson guides, mission order, and hint flow were unified to make the path easier to follow from the start.
Achievement share cards and challenge links were reorganized to simplify the sharing flow.
split 이후 select-layout, resize, swap을 조합: Learn a routine that combines select-layout, resize, and swap after splitting to quickly build your target workspace.
코드/로그/실행 영역 비율을 의도적으로 설계하고 필요 시 즉시 재배치할: Build the skill to intentionally design code/log/run area ratios and rearrange them immediately when needed.
resize-pane과 swap-pane을 각각 1회 이상 실행: Execute resize-pane and swap-pane at least once each
레이아웃 선택 없이 분할만 반복해 원하는 구조를 고정하지 못함: Only repeated splits without choosing layouts, so the target structure was not stabilized
재배치(swap) 없이 포커스 이동만 수행해 화면 구조 제어가 부족함: Only moved focus without swap-based rearrangement, so screen structure control is insufficient
split 이후 select-layout, resize, swap을 조합: Learn a routine that combines select-layout, resize, and swap after splitting to quickly build your target workspace. This lesson repeats the same workflow with shortcuts.
코드/로그/실행 영역 비율을 의도적으로 설계하고 필요 시 즉시 재배치할: Build the skill to intentionally design code/log/run area ratios and rearrange them immediately when needed. After command-path execution, reproduce the same flow with prefix shortcuts to improve speed.
`tmux split-window -h`, `tmux split-wind: Create 3 panes with `tmux split-window -h` and `tmux split-window -v`, then run `tmux select-layout even-horizontal` or `tmux select-layout tiled`.
`tmux list-panes`와 `tmux display-message: Check the applied state with `tmux list-panes` and `tmux display-message -p '#{window_layout}'`.
`tmux resize-pane -L 5`/`-R 5` 또는 `tmux: Adjust pane ratios with `tmux resize-pane -L 5`/`-R 5` or `tmux resize-pane -U 3`/`-D 3`.
Small adjustments (3-5 cells) repeated 2-3 times make target ratios easier to reach.
`tmux swap-pane -s :.0 -t :.1`처럼 pane 위치: Swap pane positions, for example with `tmux swap-pane -s :.0 -t :.1`.
교체 후 `tmux select-layout main-vertical`: After swapping, finish with `tmux select-layout main-vertical` or `tmux select-layout tiled` to quickly stabilize the layout.
명령 경로 후 `Ctrl+b` + `%` 또는 `Ctrl+b` + `\": After the command path, run one more split with `Ctrl+b` + `%` or `Ctrl+b` + `"` to leave shortcut execution history.
swap은 `tmux swap-pane -s :.0 -t :.1`처럼 명: Run swap via command (for example `tmux swap-pane -s :.0 -t :.1`), and leave shortcut history by doing one of `Ctrl+b` + `%` or `Ctrl+b` + `H/J/K/L` once.
